trans-unit.source: Fundamentals of garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收的基本知识

trans-unit.source: Fundamentals of garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收的基本知识

trans-unit.source: .NET, .NET Core
trans-unit.target: .NET、.NET Core

trans-unit.source: Fundamentals of garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收的基本知识

trans-unit.source: In the Common Language Runtime (CLR), the garbage collector serves as an automatic memory manager.
trans-unit.target: 在公共语言运行时 (CLR) 中，垃圾回收器用作自动内存管理器。

trans-unit.source: It provides the following benefits:
trans-unit.target: 它提供如下优点：

trans-unit.source: Enables you to develop your application without having to free memory.
trans-unit.target: 使你可以在开发应用程序时不必释放内存。

trans-unit.source: Allocates objects on the managed heap efficiently.
trans-unit.target: 有效分配托管堆上的对象。

trans-unit.source: Reclaims objects that are no longer being used, clears their memory, and keeps the memory available for future allocations.
trans-unit.target: 回收不再使用的对象，清除它们的内存，并保留内存以用于将来分配。

trans-unit.source: Managed objects automatically get clean content to start with, so their constructors do not have to initialize every data field.
trans-unit.target: 托管对象会自动获取干净的内容来开始，因此，它们的构造函数不必对每个数据字段进行初始化。

trans-unit.source: Provides memory safety by making sure that an object cannot use the content of another object.
trans-unit.target: 通过确保对象不能使用另一个对象的内容来提供内存安全。

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the core concepts of garbage collection.
trans-unit.target: 本主题介绍垃圾回收的核心概念。

trans-unit.source: It contains the following sections:
trans-unit.target: 它包含下列部分：

trans-unit.source: [Fundamentals of memory](#fundamentals-of-memory)
trans-unit.target: [内存基础知识](#fundamentals-of-memory)

trans-unit.source: [Conditions for a garbage collection](#conditions-for-a-garbage-collection)
trans-unit.target: [垃圾回收的条件](#conditions-for-a-garbage-collection)

trans-unit.source: [The managed heap](#the-managed-heap)
trans-unit.target: [托管堆](#the-managed-heap)

trans-unit.source: [Generations](#generations)
trans-unit.target: [代数](#generations)

trans-unit.source: [What happens during a garbage collection](#what-happens-during-a-garbage-collection)
trans-unit.target: [垃圾回收过程中发生的情况](#what-happens-during-a-garbage-collection)

trans-unit.source: [Manipulating unmanaged resources](#manipulating-unmanaged-resources)
trans-unit.target: [操作非托管资源](#manipulating-unmanaged-resources)

trans-unit.source: Fundamentals of memory
trans-unit.target: 内存基础知识

trans-unit.source: The following list summarizes important CLR memory concepts.
trans-unit.target: 下面的列表总结了重要的 CLR 内存概念。

trans-unit.source: Each process has its own, separate virtual address space.
trans-unit.target: 每个进程都有其自己单独的虚拟地址空间。

trans-unit.source: All processes on the same computer share the same physical memory, and share the page file if there is one.
trans-unit.target: 同一台计算机上的所有进程共享相同的物理内存，如果有页文件，则也共享页文件。

trans-unit.source: By default, on 32-bit computers, each process has a 2-GB user-mode virtual address space.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，32 位计算机上的每个进程都具有 2 GB 的用户模式虚拟地址空间。

trans-unit.source: As an application developer, you work only with virtual address space and never manipulate physical memory directly.
trans-unit.target: 作为一名应用程序开发人员，你只能使用虚拟地址空间，请勿直接操控物理内存。

trans-unit.source: The garbage collector allocates and frees virtual memory for you on the managed heap.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收器为你分配和释放托管堆上的虚拟内存。

trans-unit.source: Virtual memory can be in three states:
trans-unit.target: 虚拟内存有三种状态：

trans-unit.source: Free.
trans-unit.target: 可用。

trans-unit.source: The block of memory has no references to it and is available for allocation.
trans-unit.target: 该内存块没有引用关系，可用于分配。

trans-unit.source: Reserved.
trans-unit.target: 保留。

trans-unit.source: The block of memory is available for your use and cannot be used for any other allocation request.
trans-unit.target: 内存块可供你使用，并且不能用于任何其他分配请求。

trans-unit.source: However, you cannot store data to this memory block until it is committed.
trans-unit.target: 但是，在该内存块提交之前，你无法将数据存储到其中。

trans-unit.source: Committed.
trans-unit.target: 提交。

trans-unit.source: The block of memory is assigned to physical storage.
trans-unit.target: 内存块已指派给物理存储。

trans-unit.source: Virtual address space can get fragmented.
trans-unit.target: 可能会存在虚拟地址空间碎片。

trans-unit.source: This means that there are free blocks, also known as holes, in the address space.
trans-unit.target: 就是说地址空间中存在一些被称为孔的可用块。

trans-unit.source: When a virtual memory allocation is requested, the virtual memory manager has to find a single free block that is large enough to satisfy that allocation request.
trans-unit.target: 当请求虚拟内存分配时，虚拟内存管理器必须找到满足该分配请求的足够大的单个可用块。

trans-unit.source: Even if you have 2 GB of free space, the allocation that requires 2 GB will be unsuccessful unless all of that space is in a single address block.
trans-unit.target: 即使你具有 2 GB 的可用空间，2 GB 的分配请求也有可能会不成功，除非所有这些空间必须位于单个的地址块中。

trans-unit.source: You can run out of memory if you run out of virtual address space to reserve or physical space to commit.
trans-unit.target: 如果用完保留的虚拟地址空间或提交的物理空间，则可能会用尽内存。

trans-unit.source: Your page file is used even if physical memory pressure (that is, demand for physical memory) is low.
trans-unit.target: 即使在物理内存压力（即物理内存的需求）较低的情况下也会使用页文件。

trans-unit.source: The first time your physical memory pressure is high, the operating system must make room in physical memory to store data, and it backs up some of the data that is in physical memory to the page file.
trans-unit.target: 首次出现物理内存压力较高的情况时，操作系统必须在物理内存中腾出空间来存储数据，并将物理内存中的部分数据备份到页文件中。

trans-unit.source: That data is not paged until it is needed, so it is possible to encounter paging in situations where the physical memory pressure is very low.
trans-unit.target: 该数据只会在需要时进行分页，所以在物理内存压力非常低的情况下也可能会进行分页。

trans-unit.source: Conditions for a garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收的条件

trans-unit.source: Garbage collection occurs when one of the following conditions is true:
trans-unit.target: 当满足以下条件之一时将发生垃圾回收：

trans-unit.source: The system has low physical memory.
trans-unit.target: 系统具有低的物理内存。

trans-unit.source: The memory that is used by allocated objects on the managed heap surpasses an acceptable threshold.
trans-unit.target: 由托管堆上已分配的对象使用的内存超出了可接受的阈值。

trans-unit.source: This threshold is continuously adjusted as the process runs.
trans-unit.target: 随着进程的运行，此阈值会不断地进行调整。

trans-unit.source: The [GC.Collect](xref:System.GC.Collect) method is called.
trans-unit.target: 调用了 [GC.Collect](xref:System.GC.Collect) 方法。

trans-unit.source: In almost all cases, you do not have to call this method, because the garbage collector runs continuously.
trans-unit.target: 几乎在所有情况下，你都不必调用此方法，因为垃圾回收器会持续运行。

trans-unit.source: This method is primarily used for unique situations and testing.
trans-unit.target: 此方法主要用于特殊情况和测试。

trans-unit.source: The managed heap
trans-unit.target: 托管堆

trans-unit.source: After the garbage collector is initialized by the CLR, it allocates a segment of memory to store and manage objects.
trans-unit.target: 在垃圾回收器由 CLR 初始化之后，它会分配一段内存用于存储和管理对象。

trans-unit.source: This memory is called the managed heap, as opposed to a native heap in the operating system.
trans-unit.target: 此内存称为托管堆（与操作系统中的本机堆相对）。

trans-unit.source: There is a managed heap for each managed process.
trans-unit.target: 每个托管进程都有一个托管堆。

trans-unit.source: All threads in the process allocate memory for objects on the same heap.
trans-unit.target: 进程中的所有线程都在同一堆上分配对象记忆。

trans-unit.source: The size of segments allocated by the garbage collector is implementation-specific and is subject to change at any time, including in periodic updates.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收器分配的段大小特定于实现，并且随时可能更改（包括定期更新）。

trans-unit.source: Your app should never make assumptions about or depend on a particular segment size, nor should it attempt to configure the amount of memory available for segment allocations.
trans-unit.target: 应用程序不应假设特定段的大小或依赖于此大小，也不应尝试配置段分配可用的内存量。

trans-unit.source: The fewer objects allocated on the heap, the less work the garbage collector has to do.
trans-unit.target: 堆上分配的对象越少，垃圾回收器必须执行的工作就越少。

trans-unit.source: When you allocate objects, do not use rounded-up values that exceed your needs, such as allocating an array of 32 bytes when you need only 15 bytes.
trans-unit.target: 分配对象时，请勿使用超出你需求的舍入值，例如在仅需要 15 个字节的情况下分配了 32 个字节的数组。

trans-unit.source: When a garbage collection is triggered, the garbage collector reclaims the memory that is occupied by dead objects.
trans-unit.target: 当触发垃圾回收时，垃圾回收器将回收由死对象占用的内存。

trans-unit.source: The reclaiming process compacts live objects so that they are moved together, and the dead space is removed, thereby making the heap smaller.
trans-unit.target: 回收进程会对活动对象进行压缩，以便将它们一起移动，并移除死空间，从而使堆更小一些。

trans-unit.source: This ensures that objects that are allocated together stay together on the managed heap, to preserve their locality.
trans-unit.target: 这将确保一起分配的对象全都位于托管堆上，从而保留它们的局部性。

trans-unit.source: The intrusiveness (frequency and duration) of garbage collections is the result of the volume of allocations and the amount of survived memory on the managed heap.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收的侵入性（频率和持续时间）是由分配的数量和托管堆上保留的内存数量决定的。

trans-unit.source: The heap can be considered as the accumulation of two heaps: the large object heap and the small object heap.
trans-unit.target: 此堆可视为两个堆的累计：大对象堆和小对象堆。

trans-unit.source: The large object heap contains very large objects that are 85,000 bytes and larger.
trans-unit.target: 大对象堆包含其大小为 85,000 个字节和更多字节的对象。

trans-unit.source: The objects on the large object heap are usually arrays.
trans-unit.target: 大对象堆上的对象通常是数组。

trans-unit.source: It is rare for an instance object to be extremely large.
trans-unit.target: 非常大的实例对象是很少见的。

trans-unit.source: Generations
trans-unit.target: 代数

trans-unit.source: The heap is organized into generations so it can handle long-lived and short-lived objects.
trans-unit.target: 堆按代进行组织，因此它可以处理长生存期的对象和短生存期的对象。

trans-unit.source: Garbage collection primarily occurs with the reclamation of short-lived objects that typically occupy only a small part of the heap.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收主要在回收通常只占用一小部分堆的短生存期对象时发生。

trans-unit.source: There are three generations of objects on the heap:
trans-unit.target: 堆上的对象有三代：

trans-unit.source: **Generation 0.**
This is the youngest generation and contains short-lived objects.
trans-unit.target: 这是最年轻的代，其中包含短生存期对象。

trans-unit.source: An example of a short-lived object is a temporary variable.
trans-unit.target: 短生存期对象的一个示例是临时变量。

trans-unit.source: Garbage collection occurs most frequently in this generation.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收最常发生在此代中。

trans-unit.source: Newly allocated objects form a new generation of objects and are implicitly generation 0 collections, unless they are large objects, in which case they go on the large object heap in a generation 2 collection.
trans-unit.target: 新分配的对象构成新一代的对象并且为隐式的第 0 代回收，除非它们是大对象，在这种情况下，它们将进入第 2 代回收中的大对象堆。

trans-unit.source: Most objects are reclaimed for garbage collection in generation 0 and do not survive to the next generation.
trans-unit.target: 大多数对象通过第 0 代中的垃圾回收进行回收，不会保留到下一代。

trans-unit.source: **Generation 1.**
This generation contains short-lived objects and serves as a buffer between short-lived objects and long-lived objects.
trans-unit.target: 这一代包含短生存期对象并用作短生存期对象和长生存期对象之间的缓冲区。

trans-unit.source: **Generation 2.**
This generation contains long-lived objects.
trans-unit.target: 这一代包含长生存期对象。

trans-unit.source: An example of a long-lived object is an object in a server application that contains static data that is live for the duration of the process.
trans-unit.target: 长生存期对象的一个示例是服务器应用程序中的一个包含在进程期间处于活动状态的静态数据的对象。

trans-unit.source: Garbage collections occur on specific generations as conditions warrant.
trans-unit.target: 当条件得到满足时，垃圾回收将在特定代上发生。

trans-unit.source: Collecting a generation means collecting objects in that generation and all its younger generations.
trans-unit.target: 回收某个代意味着回收此代中的对象及其所有更年轻的代。

trans-unit.source: A generation 2 garbage collection is also known as a full garbage collection, because it reclaims all objects in all generations (that is, all objects in the managed heap).
trans-unit.target: 第 2 代垃圾回收也称为完整垃圾回收，因为它回收所有代上的所有对象（即，托管堆中的所有对象）。

trans-unit.source: Survival and promotions
trans-unit.target: 幸存和提升

trans-unit.source: Objects that are not reclaimed in a garbage collection are known as survivors, and are promoted to the next generation.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收中未回收的对象也称为幸存者，并会被提升到下一代。

trans-unit.source: Objects that survive a generation 0 garbage collection are promoted to generation 1; objects that survive a generation 1 garbage collection are promoted to generation 2; and objects that survive a generation 2 garbage collection remain in generation 2.
trans-unit.target: 在第 0 代垃圾回收中幸存的对象将被提升到第 1 代；在第 1 代垃圾回收中幸存的对象将被提升到第 2 代；而在第 2 代垃圾回收中幸存的对象将仍为第 2 代。

trans-unit.source: When the garbage collector detects that the survival rate is high in a generation, it increases the threshold of allocations for that generation, so the next collection gets a substantial size of reclaimed memory.
trans-unit.target: 当垃圾回收器检测到某个代中的幸存率很高时，它会增加该代的分配阈值，因此下一次回收将会获取一个非常大的回收内存。

trans-unit.source: The CLR continually balances two priorities: not letting an application's working set get too big and not letting the garbage collection take too much time.
trans-unit.target: CLR 会在以下两个优先级别之前进行平衡：不允许应用程序的工作集获取太大内存以及不允许垃圾回收花费太多时间。

trans-unit.source: Ephemeral generations and segments
trans-unit.target: 暂时代和暂时段

trans-unit.source: Because objects in generations 0 and 1 are short-lived, these generations are known as the ephemeral generations.
trans-unit.target: 因为第 0 代和第 1 代中的对象的生存期较短，因此，这些代被称为暂时代。

trans-unit.source: Ephemeral generations must be allocated in the memory segment that is known as the ephemeral segment.
trans-unit.target: 暂时代必须在称为暂时段的内存段中进行分配。

trans-unit.source: Each new segment acquired by the garbage collector becomes the new ephemeral segment and contains the objects that survived a generation 0 garbage collection.
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收器获取的每个新段将成为新的暂时段，并包含在第 0 代垃圾回收中幸存的对象。

trans-unit.source: The old ephemeral segment becomes the new generation 2 segment.
trans-unit.target: 旧的暂时段将成为新的第 2 代段。

trans-unit.source: The ephemeral segment can include generation 2 objects.
trans-unit.target: 暂时段可以包含第 2 代对象。

trans-unit.source: Generation 2 objects can use multiple segments (as many as your process requires and memory allows for).
trans-unit.target: 第 2 代对象可使用多个段（在内存允许的情况下进程所需的任意数量）。

trans-unit.source: The amount of freed memory from an ephemeral garbage collection is limited to the size of the ephemeral segment.
trans-unit.target: 从暂时垃圾回收中释放的内存量限制为暂时段的大小。

trans-unit.source: The amount of memory that is freed is proportional to the space that was occupied by the dead objects.
trans-unit.target: 释放的内存量与死对象占用的空间成比例。

trans-unit.source: What happens during a garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收过程中发生的情况

trans-unit.source: A garbage collection has the following phases:
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收分为以下几个阶段：

trans-unit.source: A marking phase that finds and creates a list of all live objects.
trans-unit.target: 标记阶段，找到并创建所有活动对象的列表。

trans-unit.source: A relocating phase that updates the references to the objects that will be compacted.
trans-unit.target: 重定位阶段，用于更新对将要压缩的对象的引用。

trans-unit.source: A compacting phase that reclaims the space occupied by the dead objects and compacts the surviving objects.
trans-unit.target: 压缩阶段，用于回收由死对象占用的空间，并压缩幸存的对象。

trans-unit.source: The compacting phase moves objects that have survived a garbage collection toward the older end of the segment.
trans-unit.target: 压缩阶段将垃圾回收中幸存下来的对象移至段中时间较早的一端。

trans-unit.source: Because generation 2 collections can occupy multiple segments, objects that are promoted into generation 2 can be moved into an older segment.
trans-unit.target: 因为第 2 代回收可以占用多个段，所以可以将已提升到第 2 代中的对象移动到时间较早的段中。

trans-unit.source: Both generation 1 and generation 2 survivors can be moved to a different segment, because they are promoted to generation 2.
trans-unit.target: 可以将第 1 代幸存者和第 2 代幸存者都移动到不同的段，因为它们已被提升到第 2 代。

trans-unit.source: Ordinarily, the large object heap is not compacted, because copying large objects imposes a performance penalty.
trans-unit.target: 通常，由于复制大型对象会造成性能代偿，因此不会压缩大型对象堆。

trans-unit.source: However, you can use the [GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode](xref:System.Runtime.GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode) property to compact the large object heap on demand.
trans-unit.target: 但是，可使用 [GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode](xref:System.Runtime.GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode) 属性按需亚索大型对象堆。

trans-unit.source: The garbage collector uses the following information to determine whether objects are live:
trans-unit.target: 垃圾回收器使用以下信息来确定对象是否为活动对象：

trans-unit.source: **Stack roots.**
Stack variables provided by the just-in-time (JIT) compiler and stack walker.
trans-unit.target: 由实时 (JIT) 编译器和堆栈查看器提供的堆栈变量。

trans-unit.source: **Garbage collection handles.**
trans-unit.target: **垃圾回收句柄。**

trans-unit.source: Handles that point to managed objects and that can be allocated by user code or by the Common Language Runtime.
trans-unit.target: 指向托管对象且可由用户代码或公共语言运行时分配的句柄。

trans-unit.source: **Static data.**
trans-unit.target: **静态数据。**

trans-unit.source: Static objects in application domains that could be referencing other objects.
trans-unit.target: 应用程序域中可能引用其他对象的静态对象。

trans-unit.source: Each application domain keeps track of its static objects.
trans-unit.target: 每个应用程序域都会跟踪其静态对象。

trans-unit.source: Before a garbage collection starts, all managed threads are suspended except for the thread that triggered the garbage collection.
trans-unit.target: 在垃圾回收启动之前，除了触发垃圾回收的线程以外的所有托管线程均会挂起。

trans-unit.source: The following illustration shows a thread that triggers a garbage collection and causes the other threads to be suspended.
trans-unit.target: 下图演示了触发垃圾回收并导致其他线程挂起的线程。

trans-unit.source: When a thread triggers a garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 当线程触发垃圾回收时

trans-unit.source: Thread that triggers a garbage collection
trans-unit.target: 触发垃圾回收的线程

trans-unit.source: Manipulating unmanaged resources
trans-unit.target: 操作非托管资源

trans-unit.source: If your managed objects reference unmanaged objects by using their native file handles, you have to explicitly free the unmanaged objects, because the garbage collector tracks memory only on the managed heap.
trans-unit.target: 如果你的托管对象使用非托管对象的本机文件句柄来引用非托管对象，则必须显式释放非托管对象，因为垃圾回收器仅跟踪托管堆上的内存。

trans-unit.source: Users of your managed object may not dispose the native resources used by the object.
trans-unit.target: 托管对象的用户可能不会释放由该对象使用的本机资源。

trans-unit.source: To perform the cleanup, you can make your managed object finalizable.
trans-unit.target: 为了执行清理，可以使托管对象成为可终结的。

trans-unit.source: Finalization consists of cleanup actions that you execute when the object is no longer in use.
trans-unit.target: 终结由不再使用对象时执行的清理操作组成。

trans-unit.source: When your managed object dies, it performs cleanup actions that are specified in its finalizer method.
trans-unit.target: 当托管对象不活动时，它将执行在其终结器方法中指定的清理操作。

trans-unit.source: When a finalizable object is discovered to be dead, its finalizer is put in a queue so that its cleanup actions are executed, but the object itself is promoted to the next generation.
trans-unit.target: 当发现某个可终结对象处于不活动状态时，则会将其终结器放入队列中，以便执行其清理操作，但要将该对象自身提升到下一代。

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you have to wait until the next garbage collection that occurs on that generation (which is not necessarily the next garbage collection) to determine whether the object has been reclaimed.
trans-unit.target: 因此，你必须等待该代上发生下一次垃圾回收（并不一定是下一次垃圾回收），以确定对象是否已收回。

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: 另请参阅

trans-unit.source: [Garbage collection in .NET](gc.md)
trans-unit.target: [.NET 中的垃圾回收](gc.md)
